program_description_1: This program provides financial assistance to eligible applicants that will provide high speed internet service in rural communities.
program_description_2: The projects funded by these grants help rural residents tap into the enormous potential of the internet for jobs, education, healthcare, public safety and community development.
eligible_area_criteria_1: Rural areas that lack internet speeds of 10 megabits per second (Mbps) downstream and 1Mbps upstream.
eligible_area_guidance_tool: The Broadband Mapping Tool provides guidance on rural areas currently eligible for Community Connect Grants.
funds_use_purpose_1: construction, acquisition, or leasing of facilities, spectrum, land or buildings used to deploy broadband service
funds_use_beneficiary_1: All residential and business customers located within the Proposed Funded Service Area
funds_use_beneficiary_2: All participating essential community facilities (such as public schools, fire stations, public libraries, and public safety stations)
funds_use_additional_1: Cover the cost of providing high-speed internet free of charge to essential community facilities for 2 years
funds_use_additional_2: Up to 10 percent of the grant may be used for the improvement, expansion, construction, or acquisition of a community center that provides online access to the public
other_requirements_2: An executive summary of the proposed project
other_requirements_3: Grantees must have legal authority to provide, construct, operate and maintain the proposed facilities or services
other_requirements_4: Matching funds of at least 15 percent from non-federal sources are required and can be used for operating costs
other_requirements_5: Partnerships with other federal, state, local, private, and nonprofit entities are encouraged
note_official_instructions_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
